thread.title: Win England v Australia ODI tickets: Terms and Conditions
thread.title_full: Win England v Australia ODI tickets: Terms and Conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Win England v Australia ODI tickets: Terms and Conditions
text: Telegraph Umpire Challenge Game in association with Specsavers – Prize Draws Terms and Conditions 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over. Employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and Specsavers Optical Group Limited (“Specsavers”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw are not eligible to enter. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entrants to this prize draw must visit telegraph.co.uk/specsavers and complete the Telegraph Umpire Challenge Game. Entrants scoring six correct decisions out of six will be invited to submit their entry by completing the entry form. Entry is restricted to one per person. Entries cannot be amended in any way after submission. 4. The decision in each Telegraph Umpire Challenge Game in/out scenario has been made by two independent ECB registered cricket umpires and their decisions are final. No correspondence over their decisions will be entered into. 5. Entries must be received by midnight on Monday 31 August 2015. 6. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt or entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of submission of an entry will not be accepted as proof of receipt. 7. The winners will be the first three entries drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a stamped, addressed envelope to Telegraph Umpire Challenge Prize Draw Winners, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month of the closing date of the draw. 8. The Promoter will contact the winners by telephone by 13:00 on Tuesday 1 September 2015. Should the Promoter be unable to contact a winner by this deadline or if a winner is unable to accept their prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award that prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these Terms and Conditions. 9. The prizes as described are available on the date of publication. Should a prize become unavailable, a substitute prize of equal value shall be provided. 10. Three winning entrants will each win a pair of tickets to one of the three 2015 Royal London One Day Internationals between England and Australia, which take place on the following dates: • 1st Royal London ODI (Day/Night) Thursday 3 September, 2pm at The Ageas Bowl; • 2nd Royal London ODI Saturday 5 September, 10.30am at Lord's; • 3rd Royal London ODI (Day/Night) Tuesday 8 September, 2pm at Emirates Old Trafford The tickets will be allocated to the winners by the Promoter and no correspondence or negotiation over the allocation will be entered into. 11. The winners must collect their tickets from the ticket collection point at the respective ODI venue, where winners will be required to produce photo ID in order to claim their prize 12. The prizes do not include travel to or from the event, accommodation, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs. 13. All prizes are subject to availability, non-transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 14. The winners may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of Specsavers and the Promoter. 15. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 16. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prizes impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and/or Specsavers. Accordingly the Promoter and/or Specsavers may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter and/or Specsavers as a result thereof. 17. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prizes is the responsibility of Specsavers Optical Group Limited. 18. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
